subject: Languages
title: Esperanto's Persecution
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Esperanto's Persecution.

hook.text: Both Hitler and Stalin banned Esperanto. They feared it because it worked.

buildup.text: Esperanto attracted idealists, pacifists, and internationalists â€” enemies of totalitarian states.

discovery.text: Hitler called it a Jewish conspiracy language (Zamenhof was Jewish). Stalin banned it as cosmopolitan.

twist.text: The Nazis murdered Zamenhof's three children in the Holocaust specifically because of Esperanto.

climax.text: Esperanto survived both dictators. It thrives today because no government controls it.

punchline.text: Dictators feared a language built for peace â€” and proved exactly why it was needed.

quiz.question: Why did Hitler and Stalin both ban Esperanto?
options: It promoted internationalism, threatening their power
It was too difficult to learn
It competed with their national languages
